cm3038.search

Class SearchProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • cm3038.search.SearchProblem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BestFirstSearchProblem, Sq8Problem

    public abstract class SearchProblem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the default behaviour of a search problem. Any class modelling a domain-specific search problem must extend this class.
    Author:
    Kit-ying Hui

    • Field Detail

      • nodeVisited

        public int nodeVisited
        This attribute counts the number of nodes visited. This includes the root node and other generated nodes. This value is set to 0 when the SearchProblem is created. Invoking the search() method does not reset the value. You can manually reset it if you want.

      • startState

        protected State startState
        The initial state of the problem.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchProblem

        public SearchProblem(State start)
        Create a SearchProblem instance with an initial state.
        Parameters:
        start - The initial state of the search problem.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public Path search()
        Perform a search. The current implementation uses breadth-first search.
        Returns:
        null if no solution is found. Or a Path object otherwise.

      • addChildrenNodes

        protected void addChildrenNodes(java.util.List<Node> fringe,
                                Node parentNode,
                                java.util.List<ActionStatePair> children)
        Given a list of action-state pairs, add them as children of the current node.
        Parameters:
        fringe - The fringe of the tree to explore.
        parentNode - The parent node of these children.
        children - A list of children as action-state pairs.

      • addChild

        protected void addChild(java.util.List<Node> fringe,
                        Node childNode)
        Adding a child Node into the fringe list. Note that it is a Node, not a State that we are adding into the fringe. The first node in the fringe list is the next one to be expanded. The default strategy is adding the child to the end of the fringe, giving a breadth-first behaviour. By overriding this method in a subclass, you can change how the search tree is expanded. In a more sophisticated version, you can sort the fringe list according to a criteria. For example, if you insert the child right before a Node whose cost is greater than the child, the fringe will be sorted in ascending order of the cost.
        Parameters:
        fringe - The list of Node awaiting to be expanded.
        childNode - The child Node to be added to the fringe list.

      • constructPath

        protected Path constructPath(Node node)
        Given a goal Node, construct the Path from the root to this goal by tracing the parentNode pointer/reference in each Node.
        Parameters:
        node - A Node from which to trace to the root.
        Returns:
        A Path leading from the root to this Node.

      • isGoal

        public abstract boolean isGoal(State state)
        Test if a state is goal.
        Parameters:
        state - The goal to test.
        Returns:
        true if state is a goal. false otherwise.
